CDISC Notes: Unique identifier for a study.
Two-character abbreviation for the domain.

Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or
submissions involving the product.

Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any
valid number.
Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
Internal or external Reproductive System Findings record identifier.

Sponsor-defined identifier. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or
defined in the sponsor’s operational database.

Variable Label: Repro System Findings Test Short Name
CDISC Notes:
Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in RPTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in RPTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g.”1TEST”). RPTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples:
NUMLIV, NUMPREG, BCMETHOD, etc.

Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in RPTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Number of Live Births,
Number of Pregnancies, Birth Control Method, etc.
Used to define a category of related records.
A further categorization of RP records.

Variable Label: Result or Finding in Original Units
CDISC Notes: Result of the Reproductive System Findings test as originally received or collected.
Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for RPORRES. Examples: YEARS.

Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from RPORRES in a standard format or standard units. RPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in RPSTRESN. For example, if a test has results “NONE”, “NEG”, and “NEGATIVE” in RPORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning; they could be represented in standard format in
RPSTRESC as “NEGATIVE”.
Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from RPSTRESC. RPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
Standardized unit used for RPSTRESC and RPSTRESN.

Used to indicate that a Reproductive System Findings test was not done. Should be null if a
result exists in RPORRES.
Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: BROKEN EQUIPMENT or SUBJECT REFUSED. Used in conjunction with RPSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be “Y” or null.

Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null. Records which represent the average of other records or which do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If RPDRVFL=Y, then RPORRES may be null,
with RPSTRESC and (if numeric) RPSTRESN having the derived value.

1. Clinical encounter number.
2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter.
2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
Date of Reproductive System Finding.

Variable Label: Study Day of Repro System Findings
CDISC Notes:
1. Study day of Reproductive System Findings observation, measured as integer days.
2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
